src.groovy
Class ImageTool

Helper class for handling images. Keeps a currently loaded image, as well as the result of applying operations to that image. Operations will not affect the original image but will store the resulting image on the "result" field. Based on the article http://www.evolt.org/article/Image_Manipulation_with_CFMX_and_JAI/18/33907/index.html

see:
Masking operation gotchas

           Crops the image and stores the result

           Returns the resulting image as a byte array.
def getHeight()
           Should a thumbnail be created only if it will be smaller in size than the current image?
def getWidth()
           Returns the width for the currently loaded image
void load(String file)
           Loads an image from a file.
void load(def bytes)
           Loads an image from a byte array.
void loadAlpha(String file)
           Loads an alpha mask from a file and saves it on the cache
void loadMask(String file)
           Loads a mask from a file and saves it on the cache, indexed by the file name
void restoreOriginal()
           Restores a snapshot onto the original image.
void saveOriginal()
           Saves a snapshot of the currently loaded image
void setImageToNull()
          
void square()
           Crops the image to a square, centered, and stores it in the result image
void swapSource()
           Overwrites the current image with the latest result image obtained.
void thumbnail(float edgeLength)
           Creates a thumbnail of a maximum length and stores it in the result image
void thumbnailSpecial(float maxWidth, float maxHeight, int interPolationType, int renderingType)
           This method creates a thumbnail of the maxWidth and maxHeight it takes as a parameter Example : Calling the method thumnailSpecial(640, 480, 1, 1) will never produce images larger than 640 on the width, and never larger than 480 on the height and use InterpolationBilinear(8) and scale The maximum width the thumbnail is allowed to have The maximum height the thumbnail is allowed to have Is for you to choose what interpolation you wish to use 1 : InterpolationBilinear(8) // Produces good image quality with smaller image size(byte) then the other two 2 : InterpolationBicubic(8) // Supposed to produce better than above, but also larger size(byte) 3 : InterpolationBicubic2(8) // Supposed to produce the best of the three, but also largest size(byte) Too choose the rendering type 1: Uses scale // Better on larger thumbnails 2: Uses SubsampleAverage // Produces clearer images when it comes to really small thumbnail e.g 80x60
void writeResult(String file, String type)
           Writes the resulting image to a file.

crop

public void crop(float edgeX, def edgeY)
Crops the image and stores the result
param:
edgeX Horizontal crop. The image will be cropped edgeX/2 on both sides.
param:
edgeY Vertical crop. The image will be cropped edgeY/2 on top and bottom.

thumbnailSpecial

public void thumbnailSpecial(float maxWidth, float maxHeight, int interPolationType, int renderingType)
This method creates a thumbnail of the maxWidth and maxHeight it takes as a parameter Example : Calling the method thumnailSpecial(640, 480, 1, 1) will never produce images larger than 640 on the width, and never larger than 480 on the height and use InterpolationBilinear(8) and scale
param:
maxWidth
The maximum width the thumbnail is allowed to have
param:
maxHeigth
The maximum height the thumbnail is allowed to have
param:
interPolationType
Is for you to choose what interpolation you wish to use 1 : InterpolationBilinear(8) // Produces good image quality with smaller image size(byte) then the other two 2 : InterpolationBicubic(8) // Supposed to produce better than above, but also larger size(byte) 3 : InterpolationBicubic2(8) // Supposed to produce the best of the three, but also largest size(byte)
param:
renderingType
Too choose the rendering type 1: Uses scale // Better on larger thumbnails 2: Uses SubsampleAverage // Produces clearer images when it comes to really small thumbnail e.g 80x60

writeResult

public void writeResult(String file, String type)
Writes the resulting image to a file.
param:
file full path where the image should be saved
param:
type file type for the image

Possible JAI encodings
